comment: Professor Patrono uses a textbook and has pre-recorded video lectures for students to watch. Exams and quizzes are all open note, but are timed. It's also my understanding that he has video lectures for his in-person classes as well. He also provides practice quiz questions on D2L and gets back to you within a reasonable amount of time via email.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I absolutely love Patrono; he is my favorite professor. He cares about you and does his best to help you succeed. Showing up and talking to him matters. The more he knows you and sees you trying to succeed, the more he'll help. The tests can be hard, but he curves them. Study the practice questions, and you should pass every test.

Professor Patrono is average, his lectures and powerpoints are similar to the tests and weekly quizzes. You will have to apply yourself, so study the material thoroughly. One quiz and exam dropped. There are recorded lectures available online.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Patrono is a nice person and a good professor for ECON. His lectures are interesting and engaging. There are three tests and a final; one test gets dropped. The quizzes are online, with no lockdown. One quiz gets dropped as well. Tests are in person, but not super difficult. I'd recommend I'm taking him again for a different class
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitly take him his tests are easy if you go to lectures and the lowest is replaced by the final.

Professor Patrono has true vocational skills for this subject. His lectures are very helpful and he is also very fair. Weekly assignments, extra credit assignments, and couple exams which are not lockdown. Take him, he is legit and really care about his students. Textbook is not required which is a plus for me.

He was a good professor but I find Econ to be a very hard subject to learn. graded by 3/4 Exams 75% drops your lowest one except for the final exam and 20/21 quizzes 25% drop your lowest quiz. If it were less exam and quiz heavy It would be better.

A pretty great professor in my opinion. He not only provides many resources for the class (powerpoints, an online textbook, study guides, etc) but he also supports his topics with real-life examples which is helpful. The homework is super easy and open note. The exams are tougher, but not impossible to get high grades on as long as you study.

I took Dr. Patrono for Honors ECON1000, and he was amazing! We only had 3 straightforward tests, one being the final, which was not cumulative. There were also online D2L quizzes for each chapter and two essays (500 words) specifically for the honors section. He tends to talk a lot, but all resources are online, so it's very easy to pass!

Awesome professor. His lectures make the content easy to understand to where you don't really have to read the textbook, just take notes and look over them before tests/quizzes. You can always watch his narrated lectures online if you miss class, and he is very accommodating. There's also plenty of extra credit if you need. (Class is 10 weeks btw).

I took him for both ECON 1000 and ECON 1100. He is a GREAT prof. His lectures are fun and enjoyable. He records the lectures so you can review them latter and while he won't just give you the A he makes it as straight forward as possible to get a good grade.

Professor Patrono's ECON1000 class is a breeze. With dropped tests, optional attendance, and helpful online resources like the recorded lectures, it's easy to succeed. Unstuck study AI is a great addition to the mix along with the free textbook.

Records all lectures which is awesome!! He talked a little slower, so I just didn't go to class and watched the videos instead, in 2x speed. Tests are in person, but after watching all the lectures, I felt really ready. He knows his stuff, and it shows in his lectures. There are extra credit opportunities as well!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This professor was very easy, I passed this class without any issues. The only work expected from you I a weekly quiz and then there are 4 tests, and your lowest grade gets dropped. If you simply go to class or even just watch his videos and skip class he gives all the information needed to finish the quiz. Just study for the test and you will pass
Other reviews some him up very well. His lectures are great and the tests are curved. Best three of the four tests are 75% of the grade, while chapter quizzes are the other 25%.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This class consists of weekly readings and quizzes. There are 4 exams total with one being the final. He drops your lowest exam (except the final which is mandatory) and your lowest quiz grade. He also curves the exams (around 10-15 points I believe). If you study the lecture slides as well as the practice questions you can do fine in this class.

This class has 4 exams including the final and your lowest exam grade is dropped. His tests were difficult for many because of the wording of the questions. His lectures felt really long because he would stay on one slide for 30 minutes. He calls on people. Fortunately, he has all his lectures online and gives out study guides.

Per-chapter homework via open-note quizzes, chances for extra credit, and tests give very high reward for studying. Patrono's lectures are unique and quite funny, and will stay in your head while studying. COME TO CLASS! If you struggle with econ, pay attention to lectures and you will THRIVE. 5 out of 5!
He had quizzes over each chapter, and four major tests. but also had extra credit opportunities. its like everyother economics class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Over all Professor is a good guy and is entertaining to listen to, But when knowing what exactly to study for exams there is a big grey area, nobody really knows what they need to study because he just tells us to look at the power points. Each power point is 50 slides? So carefully consider that when registering for his class.

Professor Patrono uses his own textbook for his ECON1000 course. Not charismatic at all, hard to pay attention to in class. My semester he still had his lectures available online as a remnant of the peak of pandemic when everything was online. If he still provides that, I suggest just watching the lectures online on your own time.
just a quiz a week and test were super easy as long as you glance at the study guide

Mr. Patrono makes the content very easy to understand. He posts the powerpoint slides online which are narrated. There are weekly online quizzes and 3 tests in person. There are many extra credit opportunities as well.

Attendance isn't mandatory and all of the information is online. His lectures are good; he explains concepts well and makes everyone understand everything. He drops your lowest quiz and the lowest exam grade out of the first 2 exams. Your grade is made up of one exam, your final, and your quiz average so score well on everything.
best professor
goated
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Patrono is one of the best professors around. It is nearly impossible to fail this class. One test is dropped out of 3 exams during the semester, the last being the final. He was always accessible outside of class and was a very chill teacher. His main teaching method is PowerPoint but the way he explains keeps lectures being boring

I don't understand how people could have failed if they went to class and took notes. The content is 90% the same as my high school econ class with a bit of expansions on some of the topics. He tests on overall concepts with the most important ones having multiple questions. He uses lots of examples in class and can be pretty funny.

In honors, he doesn't drop a test but it's only three of them so make sure you study! Overall, he has very funny and interesting lectures that can actually relate to the content on the test. If you do the study guides, you will pass his tests! He is very insightful! The textbook is needed for this class so make sure you purchase it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: A very chill guy, and he posts all of the lectures with AND without narration. Only three tests, and one is dropped. I would absolutely recommend Mr. Patrono.

Strongly recommend!! Every class is a lecture, but attendance is not mandatory. You can miss class and find all the info on D2L. He has great study guides. The test q's that reference the book are on the study guide. His lectures are so easy to understand; he clearly cares about his students. He uses so many examples to make the content easy.
A very kind professor who takes his time to go through and explain his lectures very clearly so they are easy to understand.
A very kind professor who goes through his lectures and explains them very clearly.
He is a great professor who is professionals, and well educated too.

Overall a good professor. I took this class during the summer semester and it was an online class. Lectures tended to be long. Tests were a bit difficult but if you studied well you would be fine. He dropped the lowest quiz grade (out of 11) and dropped the lowest exam grade (out of 2 exams). He also provided 2 extra credit opportunities.

He not only explains basic topics thoroughly but also presents real-life examples and challenges students to critically analyze and make their own decisions. While some may perceive this as offensive, he encourages open discussions and promotes independent thinking and creates a intellectually stimulating classroom environment.

This professor managed to turn what should be an easy class to a ridiculously hard class. Offensive comments, cynical outlook on life and just plain excessive material. This guy enjoys just hearing the sound of his own voice. Trust me when I say stay far away! Much easier and likable professors available.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance isn't required but is recommended because he has great lectures. You can miss a class and everything will be on D2L. There is three exams(all in person) and 10 quizzes(online) and the lowest one will be dropped. There is a lot of extra credit opportunities.

This class is a pretty easy A as long as you study. As a professor, Patrono is okay, but he does have a tendency to ramble and get carried away easily. Also, he can bring up controversial topics in his examples which may offend some people but he doesn't intentionally set out to be offensive. Just make sure you look at the textbook and PowerPoints.

I did not sheit in this class and passed with a 64. 3 big in person tests and the rest of the quizzes were online. When i went to the class for the first week patrono was chill. If you were to apply yourself you can definetly get an A.

The class is easy if you actually study for the tests, so many people don't study and then complain. Use the study guides and practice tests. Lectures were ok he was kinda weird with his examples sometimes (if you are a girl in stem or nursing he will always use you as examples in scenarios.) you can skip and not miss anything he posts everything.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He is a very good lecturer, very engaging. He does have a preference towards a certain economic system and he makes that clear, but he still teaches the pros and cons of others. I enjoyed his class and I would recommend him for anyone, the content is very easy and he gives good examples. He does say out of pocket things sometimes, but not too bad.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Patrono is a very funny man. Great at explaining topics and making small connections with students. Sometimes he can say mildly offensive things, but I didn't think it was that big of a deal. Weekly quizzes and only two tests so make at least one of them count. He drops the lowest one, you have to take the final though.

Very nice professor that makes his lectures somewhat interesting with funny jokes, stories, and interactions. There is a quiz due every week but they aren't too hard because they're open note. 3 tests total, including the final. LOTS of extra credit opportunities. If you don't like getting called on randomly, sit in the back

This was my favorite professor I've had so far. He really is passionate about the topic and "dumbed" the ideas down so that everyone could understand the concepts easily. If you are skeptical about taking him because of previous comments, ignore them. He just teaches economics in a factual and entertaining way! Keep it up Professor Patrono!

There's 3 grades quizzes 30%, midterm 35% (only 1 test counts), final 35%. He rants with examples but never explains the topic teaches as if he was scholar. All test questions made by him and he words them to purposely tries to tricks his students. When I would go to see what I got wrong he would chuckle at my mistakes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Patrono was amazing! His lectures are very interactive and he uses real world examples to help you to really understand the concepts. Would 100% take him again.

I would not take this class again! The tests are worded very weirdly because he created them himself. His tests are somewhat difficult with the study guide. If you don't buy the textbook, which he also created, you have to study the PowerPoints to pass the tests. He doesn't teach fr, just rambles on one slide of the whole time.

I took this class 100% online, which I highly reccomend. If i'm being honest, I didn't listen to a single lecture (if he had any). The only time I heard him talk was a "good luck in college" message the last day of the class. Understand, and be able to apply concepts assigned in the text book and you're golden.
His views on women are straight out of the 1950s. Avoid this professor if you are a woman or a person of color.
This guy involves race and gender in everything. Very political to the point it makes people uncomfortable. He's supposed to be an Economics professor.

Patrono is hilarious and his lectures are engaging. I have no problems paying attention and learning what I need. He gives a lot of examples and has conversations with students during the lectures to illustrate his points. Overall a very good professor that I highly recommend.

Great professor, class is kinda lecture heavy but he has lectures recorded and posted online if you miss class. He has great humor and a generous grading policy. Textbook isn't necessary and the quizzes and tests are easy if you do the study guides.
Great teacher. Just make sure to either go to class or watch video lectures.

very chill guy, good sense of humor. attendance is not necessary, his lectures are him reading off of a slide he has already posed online. One quiz a week, which are extremely easy. One exam, one midterm, and one final. the lowest exam/midterm grade gets dropped. easy A.

Generous grading policy with one dropped quiz and exam. Very lecture-heavy class but the lectures are all posted online in case you miss any and he gives lots of examples and really makes sure that everyone understands everything. Textbook is mostly unnecessary.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The textbook you use for his class, he wrote. I felt like a lot of his lectures were very opinionated. If you don't think like him, you'll definitely struggle in his class. With that said, he has office hours, so if you're struggling to understand something, he drops everything to make sure you understand when you work with him one-on-one.

This class is very lecture-heavy but he posts all of the lectures online. Looking at the lectures and the study guides will really prepare you for the quizzes. Plus he drops your lowest test grade and midterm and the final isn't cumulative. Also, all of the quizzes and exams are multiple choice

Professor Patrono was a good professor overall. The class was very lecture heavy and also had reading to do from the textbook he wrote that you had to buy. If you don't buy this textbook, you won't have access to some of the material. Tests were hard even if you did study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Patrono is excellent. He doesn't have mandatory attendance, but he provides good examples in person for many of the concepts. I recommend doing the study guides before each exam because it uses the textbook and lecture slides to complete them, leading me to get A's on the exams. He also offers easy extra credit for the final exam.

Patrono is very kind and a good professor. Attendance isn't mandatory but I would say go, he makes the material very easy to understand because of the examples he gives and he is open to questions, he truly just wants you to have a clear understanding. Tests are a bit hard but as long as you do the study guide (optional) you'll do good.

I absolutely recommend taking Patrono for Econ 1000. All of his lecture slides are posted on D2L, so you don't have to come to his lectures as you can access it directly from online. I would recommend attending though, as he does a great job setting up examples to help you understand the material. There are also lots of extra credit opportunities.

Really great and easy professor. One quiz every week online and non-proctored. Three tests in-person including the final which is non-cumulative. He gives tons of extra credit opportunities and drops the lowest quiz and test grade at the end of the semester. Don't waste your money on the textbook I never used it and did great.

I loved Mr. Patrono. The material is accessible and his lectures were straightforward. If you miss class or choose not to go he posts pre-recorded lectures and PowerPoints ahead of time. He really is a great professor. Definitely take him!

He helped me understand econ a little better and lectures aren't mandatory. The tests are hard unless you read the textbook, which I didn't and got mid-80s on them. The quizzes are online and from the notes, but some questions he doesn't even go over some. He uses analogies but no real-world examples which was annoying. Otherwise, it's passable fs

Personally, I did not like this professor at all. His study guides are nothing like the tests, and the tests are in his own words. Attendance is not mandatory and there are a lot of extra credit opportunities. The tests are worth a lot of your grade which makes it difficult to change letter grades.

Professor Patrono is so underrated. His lectures are definitely worth going to, but it isn't mandatory. He has chapter quizzes for readings and there are 3 tests, including the final. He drops the lowest test grade and quiz grade and he is an overall great guy.

Professor Patrano is a great professor. Lectures are not mandatory but I highly recommend going. He gives study guides for each chapter, and if you complete them, you're pretty much guaranteed to get an A. You also get 2 extra credit opportunities.

Great professor and everything is online, even his lectures. If you go to class you'll be set for class. 3 exams (2 midterms) and drops the lowest midterm. Quiz every week and drops the lowest one and gives 6 points extra credit for the final. Highly recommend doing study guides and quizzes in the textbook, I made an A on every test doing that.

His lectures are very good and he responds to questions very well. Very polite whenever you have questions and has no problem with civil discussion even if you disagree with him. Class is basically just quizzes which are pretty easy if you pay attention, and there are optional extra credit essays along with extra credit events you can attend.

Professor Patrono has been among the best professors I've had in all of my classes so far. He provides pre-recorded lectures on d2l for every chapter if you miss a day of class. The textbook follows his lectures perfectly if you need it (I didn't). His in-class lectures are quite enjoyable and he keeps everyone engaged by having class discussions.
He drops your lowest test and quiz grades and puts out a lot of study material for the course.
The most fair professor I've ever had. Not to mention a great teacher who explains the content thoroughly and clearly.
Just a standard prof honestly, a bit too political for my taste. Offered a lot of extra opportunities to understand the material in and out of class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance is not mandatory and I relied on the textbook to study. The classroom is formatted so that you can either choose to teach yourself via the textbook or attend class and listen to his lectures. He provides a LOT of extra credit and the class does not require a lot of effort.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great, respected, Professor. He has great lectures. I passed the class comfortably without even touching the textbook. If you show up every class and just listen to the lectures which aren't all that boring, you will do fine. take the assignments seriously as you are only graded on a few things. He is very accessible and offers lots of extra cred.
Great teacher ends class mid-semester. Using the textbooks,notes and quizzes help with the test.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Tests and quizzes are easy if you pay attention in class or go over notes

Professor Patrono Econ 1101 was class was great. 3 test and about 10 quizzes, makes up your final grade. If you actually study and pay attention to the lectures its an easy A. Attendance isnt mandatory but is recommend, he gives great lectures.
The class is super easy and he only gives one a quiz a week(they are super easy)

By far my favorite professor I have taken. There is no reason to not pass his class as he gives ample opportunity to do well: uploads all his lectures online with and without a narration, has weekly quizzes and gives out lots of extra credit opportunities. Pay attention in class, read his textbook and study the material and you will get an A
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His class is very straight forward and easy. He is clear on grading and is a relatively quick grader too. He posts narrated/non narrated powerpoints and study guides for each quiz. The quizzes are directly from the study guide. If you do the study guides, youre all set. 3 exams. Exams are basically the past 3 quizzes that you took. Overall great dr

Professor Patrono tries to make the class entertaining . In his class, he basically goes over one chapter per week and there's 11 quizes. One per chapter that are due at the end of each week. There's 3 tests you take including the final, he drops your lowest exam grade and they aren't difficult if you attend the lectures and just read the chapters
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Patrono is an extremely nice guy and you can tell hes very educated but I would not recommend his class. Tests are very difficult, majority of them are trick questions. Studying will not help you. You are only graded on a few quizzes and three tests so there isnt much room to improve your grade. Like I said, very nice guy, but terrible class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: If you're a freshman, I wouldn't recommend this class as HS does not really suit High schoolers for this class as it is Test Heavy and Quiz heavy, no classwork to help and support you if you're not doing good on the test and quizzes. So if you're not good at testing or quizzes, wouldn't recommend it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: LISTEN TO ME! DO NOT take this class with Michael "Dino" Patrono as your professor. IT Will be your worst mistake. I Promise he grades only test and freaking quizzes and the weight on them are not fairer. He does offer extra credit but it is not a big factor honestly. He is a good person but the content is heavy and is not in his lectures at all!!!

He gives lectures on PowerPoint slides which are very easy to write down but however, his quizzes for most of the questions were not in the slides, and barely in the textbook, so my average would range from 100 to 73. For half the lecture he would talk about analogies and less on the material to study for the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Patrono was a good professor. All of his material is online so its super easy and helpful to review for tests and quizzes. Assignments and quizzes are light , never too much work.

Great Professor. Provides you with all the material needed to study if you dont go to class. As long as you read each chapter, go over the narrated power point, and do the study guide, youll succeed with at least a B+

Great teacher. Horribly tricky tests. He explains the information in a way where you are 100% sure you know it, then gives a multiple choice question where all 4 answers could reasonably be correct and you have to guess which one actually is. My quiz grades ranged from 100 to 73 because of these types of questions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: The professor often lies or spouts misinformation, to put it lightly. Be careful about what he teaches. Easiest class ever, but dangerous.

This professor taught the minimester ECON 1000 course. Being that this class is only 2 weeks, he teaches it amazingly well. All the content he went over, he went over in depth with a lot of fun examples. You might get bored in class if you understand the content immediately, but it was a fun experience overall and an impossibly easy credit!

Make sure to read the chapters in the textbook and take some notes. There are weekly quizzes and about 4 tests, the 4th test is the final over the last few chapters in the book. Personally, I did not attend a single lecture the entire semester and got an A, so you can definitely pass on your own, just be sure to read the chapters in the textbook.
Probably the hardest class I have ever taken...I really wish I posted this on April 1st

I suck at econ and i got an A plus! the test and quizzes are easy as long as you listen to his lectures or use Chegg. Hes actually funny and nice to listen too. there's also extra credit from just listening to a tedtalk basically which is awesome. all in all, could not recommend enough.
Lectures were pre recorded & very much useful. dont just watch the lectures though read the text book after watching the lectures to make test and quizzes easier. He is vey understanding!
Easiest class I've ever taken. Make sure you do your work and do it right and you'll pass with flying colors.
Amazing teacher. Tests are every week but they are fairly easy. If you want an easy pass, take this class.
Very straight forward narrated lectures, tests were not too difficult, and his grading was amazing.

I feel like if this were an in-person class and not an online class due to COVID, I'd enjoy it a lot more. That being said, Dr Patrono is a solid professor and person who knows how to explain concepts well. I wish I had taken the extra credit he gave out, but even then, the class is fairly easy as long as you take notes and understand the concepts.
This ended up being essentially an async class because of COVID. Quizzes and tests are noncumulative and open note. Just read the chapter beforehand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had this professor during the 2020 covid semester, and he taught the class with more competency then any of my other professors. My experience with the class was very straightforward, watch the very easy to follow narrated powerpoints, if I felt like it maybe read a chapter from the book, and take a weekly quiz or test, all open book. 10/10.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took him in 2017. He is very lecture heavy. Everything he says is pretty important, so going to class is pretty important and vital. You do have to study a little more than usual. Tests are kinda longish. I do remember there being a study guide; yes, the study guide is pretty useful and relevant to the test!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He's pretty cool. Not easy but cool.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took his class as an online summer class and didn't take the class that serious. You'll do find if you read the textbook , take all the quizzes and tests and do the extra credit. The online lectures were pre-recorded but he is good at answering questions if you email him. There are only 2 tests and 1 final exam. He drops 2 quizzes.

i had him for online summer econ. he uploads voice-over PPT lectures and he explains the topics really well. my dad overheard a lecture and said that it was the best explanation of the federal reserve he had ever heard! he gives 2 extra credits. tests are NOT cumulative. overall this is very manageable if you work during the summer like me 10/10!

The power point lectures were very helpful. Don't rely solely on those for the quizzes and tests. Questions really make sure you can apply the concept. Text book was painfully boring to read. You need both lectures and the book for this course. Not many grades, but does offer extra credit and drops one of the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Graded by three tests, but the tests were fairly easy, and over mostly material covered in the lecture. Was the occasional question from the textbook. Easy A if you're decent at tests.

It wasn't a very difficult class. Grades are just quizzes with a few extra credit opportunities (essays). As long as you listen to the lectures and read the assigned chapters then the quizzes should be fairly easy. The lectures are easy to follow and the professor obviously cares about what he is teaching.

Professor Patrono is hilarious in class!!! You can earn 9 extra credit points that go towards your final. There are three tests, the class ends a month early, and the final is not cumulative. Attendance is not mandatory, however, you NEED to go to get a good grade. Make sure you do the study guides! His teaching style was just not for me.
easy A. just practice with quizzes and ace the easy tests. all grade is 4 tests.

I would definitely take him for econ. There were only a few test and the final was its own single unit. His lectures are really interesting, and it really makes you think about the world differently. He is also always willing to help you.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: I'm not a social studies person, hence why I got a B but his lectures weren't hard to follow since they arent premade Powerpoints. He uses student examples and has a good sense of humor so his lectures shouldn't put you to sleep. There are tons of extra credit opportunities even though I couldn't make any due to scheduling conflicts.

He is the only professor I've ever had at KSU that didn't feel the need to indoctrinate me into his ideology. He gave enthusiastic lectures about important topics and left us with the opportunity to make clear and rational conclusions free of any bias. Taking his class is a real breath of fresh air, and I cannot recommend him enough.

Yes the lectures are very boring but its not a hard class to do good in. As long as you read the textbook, take the practice test, and study you'll do fine. Be prepared for very sarcastic comments in class. Very paranoid about cheating and if he can see the answers on your scantron he'll accuse you of cheating.
Great professor and a ton of extra credit opportunities. However, the only grades in the class were test. The powerpoint helped with the test but I would also recommend using the textbook.
Only grades are tests. Boring lectures every single class.

He is a great professor, but if you want to leave early, don't take him. He likes to run over. The one time he "let us out early", it was by three minutes. The most he ran over was about nine minutes. He does a lot of class discussion, and he gives extra credit opportunities. He likes to go on tangents (which is why he runs over).

He writes his own textbook, quizzes, and tests. Meaning when you have a question on his lectures they won't simply come up on google. You really have to work for a good grade. Tests and quizzes were difficult for me, and they were open note/textbook. Extra credit is offered but I still struggled in this class. Not terrible, just really hard

Really enjoyed the class. There were many extra credit opportunities and he drops your lowest test grade (except the final). Some people didn't buy the book, but it filled in a few missing pieces before the exams. Study the practice quizzes and you'll do fine.
Only 2 tests and a final. Skip class? You won't pass. Make sure to STUDY, read the chapters in the textbook, and do the practice questions at the end of each chapter.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Patrono really makes lectures interesting. Through his different examples he really makes things understandable. Quizzes are pretty straightened if you make sure to listen to lecture or do study guide. Drops lowest two which is always helpful.

Great choice for 2100. 4 tests including final, lots of extra credit opportunities, don't need the book. Attendance isn't mandatory but his lectures are entertaining and he is great at explaining new concepts. If you just read the online practice quizzes then you can get a easy B.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: if you do the study guides you will pass the test. Dont have to buy the book but it is a little bit helpful to have. He gives great examples and really wants students to understand what he is learning. The class ends a month early than most classes. Coming to class helps alot but he does post the powerpoints online

There are only 4 test and thats it. He provides practice quizzes (not for a grade) but they help for studying for test. He lectures which are boring and you might have to read the textbook to get info he skipped in class. I found the text free online. He provides extra credit.
Dr. Patrono's online course is fairly straight forward. Online quizzes and tests. 2 Extra credit opportunities.
Gives many examples and gets students involved in answering questions. Funny guy!

I took this as a summer class. This class consisted of 3 test and a quiz for every chapter. The third counting as the final. He drops the lowest grade out of the first two test. He drops the lowest 2 quiz grades. As long as you listen to lectures and do the study guides he provides you will pass.

Professor Patrono is an amazing professor; he does an excellent job to cover the material and he really makes the lectures funny and engaging. The class only has 3 exams but they are by no means difficult as long as you put a little effort in studying. I would hands down say he is one of the best professors I took at KSU and made the class fun.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is the best class to take for Econ 1000! You do only have 3 tests for your grade, but that is the case across all Econ 1000 classes at KSU. His lectures are actually really good and he is not boring at all. He likes engaging the class and makes econ and easy to understand subject. His powerpoints & study guides match the tests perfectly.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: We only had three tests and they made up the grades for the course. I showed up to class three times (to take the tests) and I got a high B. detailed study guides which comprise the tests and he responds to emails. I copy and pasted questions from the study guide that I didn't understand and emailed them to him and he answered them all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Your grade depends on 3 exams. Take notes on his ppt. during lectures, they'll help you study for the exams. If you do decide to skip then just do his study guides and read the text to get a decent grade on the exam. He give out a decent amount of extra credit to help boost your grade and isn't monotonous which helps a lot in the morning.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Only 3 tests that are pretty much from the lecture powerpoints. Someone made a quizlet study guide for each test which really helped. I only went to class 5 times all semester and got an 88, 88, and 96 on the tests. He also offers extra credit

3 exams are the only grades and a few extra credit opportunities. That's it. Lectures from the start of class until the last minute. Literally never spoke to him or any other students. No rounding, no curve. You get what you get.
Took the online class and it was so easy, quizzes every week, three exams and drops the lowest of the first two.
Only grades are exams and a few extra credit options. Study guides help but no review at all in class for tests.

He gives the MOST boring lectures of all time, but the material isn't hard and if you pay attention you should be fine. Seriously though, this guy will lecture for a whole class about nominal GDP or something that could be explained in fifteen minutes. Also word of advice, whatever you do, DO NOT be late to his test lol

Although I do find his lectures a bit repetitive and boring sometimes, he is a good teacher to have. As long as you go to class and pay attention, you will make A's on the exam. I didn't even have to buy the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Patrono is awesome! He makes class interesting and funny because he really knows the material. and a big plus he wrote the textbook so his lectures and tests/study guides are exactly like the book so its so easy to follow. I recommend going to class to get a better understanding from his explaining and examples, but attendance isnt mandatory.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor, knows the material almost perfectly and does a wonderful job teaching the material as well. Genuine guy and good class to take to actually learn about economics.

Amazingly nice guy. He knows a lot about economics and can actually make you understand it. You don't have to go to class and there is only 3 tests. His lectures can drag on a little bit long, but for the most part excellent professor. TAKE HIM.

Only graded by two things (drops your lowest of the first two test) and then the final. He is very nice and explains things very well. Make sure to do the study guides and you should do well in the class.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's an amazing guy. Despite the fact that there are only two exams and one final, he provides lots of opportunities for you to gain extra credit points which are added to your final exam. You get out of the class what you put in it. Be sure to make use of his textbooks and study guides because those are the only things that will save your grade.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you study and take the notes you are good. He gives a study guide for every test so make sure to do it

Professor Patrono was a very easy class for me. Showed up to every class and did not really study outside of the class and finished with a 99. The inclass lectures are the same thing that are on the test. super easy and straightforward.

I took his online class and passed it easily with an A. I started out reading the textbook, but he also posts slideshows for you to view and listen to, so I used those for most of the semester. Lots of quizzes with two dropped and two chances for extra credit.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Patrono does a good job of being upbeat and informative enough to make the lectures enjoyable, and yet structured enough to be very well tapered to the test material. I showed up to all my classes and got near 100%, without ever using the book. He answers questions straightforwardly, and makes this class interesting, even if you're not into econ.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He gives out a couple of bonus credit opportunities. The lectures are boring sometimes, but fun once he goes on a tangent. I'd say that you don't have to go to class as long as you read and do the d2l practice quizzes. He doesn't clearly explain what he wants from the essay's until the first one is graded. Overall, a good choice.

The textbook is required. He wrote it and it isn't returnable. It was $60 and frankly its littered with misspellings which is annoying for that price.  The class is straightforward. It is just reading and quizzes. Somehow this is a required course even after taking the other econ2100 course. Its ok though, I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Patrono is a good choice, has 3 total tests. Lowest grade of first 2 tests gets dropped, so your grade is just 2 tests. The class is only like 10 weeks long, if its the 2 credit class. Gives extra credit films and lectures to go to that will add points to your final test grade. I went to 2 of them and I was able to boost my grade to an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Cool dude, knows what he's talking about. If you have taken econ before, it's an easy A. Study guides are basically what's on test. I didn't buy the book, but some might need it for clarity. He was funny, used good real life examples. He does offer extra credit, which is nice, but I didn't need it. Did enjoy his class, but not mandatory to go.

GREAT lecturer. Keeps you engaged with thought provoking questions and examples. Right leaning (obviously as an econ professor) so dont be triggered. Textbook is not mandatory. Beware, only 2 tests and a final each 33%. Fail one and you can figure out the rest. Attendance not mandatory, BUT show up anyways and just listen. Easy A if you do.

The class wasn't to bad. I ended up with an A. Just review the study guides in depth you'll be fine. The only thing I didn't like about the class was the teacher. He's just a really mean guy and doesn't like to help. I was confused about a topic after class and asked him for help, and he got frustrated that I didn't understand. Wouldn't take again.

Professor Patrono knows what he is talking about. I took this class thinking it would be an easy A based off of the reviews but it wasn't! The tests are really difficult. You have to buy the book because it will help you out a lot. His lectures are funny and entertaining but he is really rude if you walk in late or answer a question wrong.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Patrono is really good at getting you to relate to the subject. The course is easy enough to begin with but he just helps even more. There's only three tests, one is dropped, and the class ends around week 10. If you show up, listen for the most part, and go over his test review sheets you'll make an A.
EASIEST A. Only 3 tests and and one of them gets dropped. Study for only 2 tests and the class ends first week of March. And gives extra credit

If you are a bad test taker, DO NOT TAKE HIM. I have to retake this class. The lowest grade I've gotten in a class is a B, and I failed his class. He gives a total of 4 tests and drops 1. The 3 grades are the only grades in the class. Please find a different professor or your GPA will hate you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Grade is based off off 4 exams (and he drops the lowest one) so you have to know the material but his lectures are very helpful and understanding and he also gives you practice quizzes that are basically the exams.

He's a great prof who loves what he teaches, but he can be very rude if you make him mad, so pay attention in lecture. Only 4 tests, he drops the lowest grade.  He gives practice quizzes for each chapter that aren't graded, but... DO/STUDY THEM FOR YOUR TEST!! I studied notecards first test and made a 70, studied quizzes on the next and made 94
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE! There are only 2 tests in the class and that includes the final... The tests are really hard and the study guides are not that helpful.. If you are a bad test taker , I would not recommend taking him. Take another teacher , trust me

Online class is very difficult.  Test questions are definitely not from the book.  Struggled to get a B.  I would NOOOTTT take his class online.  Frustrating and don't even think you can google answers.  You have to really know the material and be able to apply it to problems that he does not go over .
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took him for honors microeconomics in fall of 2015.  His lectures never really corresponded to the tests, but I made a pretty good average through most of the class and even had the highest score in the class on a tough writing assignment. However, on his last test I made a 93, and my grade stood at 89.4. He would not budge on it and did not care
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took this class online in the summer of 16' and it was an easy A. there's a quiz every week and 2 tests, a final and a midterm. he drops the lowest 2 tests and gives a few points for extra credit, but you have to type long papers. Didn't look at the powerpoints, just google the answers and you'll be good. sign up for my boy.
First two test were easy but the last two were pretty hard. Ended up with a B. Just go to class take good notes(which he pretty much lays out for you).

3 tests, 2 "papers", and a final. Papers are sort of unclear, but tests are easy. Attendance isn't mandatory, but go to class or you won't pass. Study guides and notes make the tests easy. Patrono is really helpful in general and I learned a lot from him. Makes concepts clear through examples and teaches the truth about economic systems.

Patrono's a good teacher, he breaks things down so everyone can understand. Go to class because he gives mostly all of the answers  to the 4 tests in class. Special lectures you attend for extra credit. The reading is long and boring, but must skim them to do the study guides. Do the study guides with time to ask questions, and you will pass!

Professor Patrono is a great econ instructor. There are only 3 tests (he drops lowest one) and a mandatory final. If you go to class, the textbooks aren't necessary. If you don't go to class, read the textbooks. His notes on the lectures are a bit confusing, but you get used to them. He also gives extra credit.

This was the worst class I had this semester. I wish the reviews were true, but he was terrible. This man loved to argue, and made it seem like your opinion didn't matter compared to his. Study guides were not helpful, his lectures are all over the place, and he's not helpful. The wording of his tests were confusing. I wish I hadn't taken him

Do not take this man. I wish I did not listen to these reviews. His teaching is all over the place and doesn't make any sense. Does not try to help you at all when you come to him for help and told me I should "study harder" if I didn't get the information. No help at all. This is the worst professor I have ever had at KSU!
He is very educated on Economics and Is able to answer any and all questions. Attendance is not required, but if you miss a lecture you miss lots of information.

I struggled so much in this class, the tests were terrible. He's a nice guy but no so great at teaching. He reiterates the same points in 100 different ways and I didnt see it on the test. If you are taking him go in with SOME economic knowledge, more than just TV

The class doesn't have an attendance policy, but you should go to pass. The tests have 33 question in a 50 minute time frame, not too bad. He just writes notes on pad and sort of explains. He just has a horrible handwriting.
He hand writes his notes, so they are not posted online. However, he posts study guides for each test. As long as you study the study guide, you will make a good grade on the test.

SO EASY. 3 tests (one is dropped) and a final. Gives study guides and test Qs come straight from that. However, Dr. Patrono is one of the rudest professors I've ever had--calling people out because they are "poor" and using the Pell grant is just ONE of the remarks he made. Would definitely not take again. Class is easy, guy is a bigot.

Professor Patrono is hands down one of the best teachers/professors I have ever had. He not only made economics interesting, but he also made it easy. I passed with a 95 and actually understood the concepts all thanks to his teaching skills.

Patrono is very scattered throughout class and often holds you late thinking he can cover more material. Three tests not including mandatory final; lowest dropped. Two essays with unclear requirements. No quizzes. Lots of reading and he wants you to watch videos on top of the reading. Didn't discuss as much economics as he should.

Patrono is a great teacher! His lectures are straight forward and informative. I never studied too much and made an easy A. He provides practice quizzes to help guide your studying if you aren't sure of what is going on. If you are going to take microeconomics, definitely pick Michael Patrono!

Prof. Patrono is an amazing teacher! He is very knowledgable and passionate about economics. Lectures are clear and engaging - very practical. 4 tests are straightforward (final is not cumulative). Just read the book and do the practice quizzes and you'll be good. Wouldn't take ECON from anyone else!

If you are in 2100 you will have six grades, four tests and two papers. They are not that hard though, most people end up with a's or b's. He is an incredible teacher and he really knows what he is talking out. He also makes the lectures fun and interesting even if economics is not your major. If I could take the class again I definitely would.

Patrono is passionate about economics. Makes complicated topics easy to learn during his lectures by giving relevant examples in our day to day lives. Easy about attendance, but lectures are extremely valuable & needed to pass with an AB.
Basically the only things we had to do were take weekly quizzes and then 2 tests. He explains everything very clearly in his powerpoints. If you listen to those and take notes you should be fine.

Take his class, period. His lectures make everything easy to understand. Personally, I skimmed through the book, didn't watch the videos, and I made a 100 on one of the tests and the final. As long as you attend class, take notes, and study the study guide before the test, this is an easy A.  Almost made me switch my major to economics.  1110

Amazing teacher! Drops lowest test grade! tons of extra credit chances! He is hilarious and makes the subject fun! likes to use the students as examples and using examples of todays society to correlate to the lectures! Easy A if you take all the notes! Don't be shy to show your opinion either! 10% of your grade is attendance so show up!

I thought this class would be awful but I was wrong. Mr. Patrono is awesome. His lectures get the point across, and he's actually really funny. He sticks to the syllabus! Lowest test score is dropped, but the tests are easy if you study. If you don't show up, you won't do well, points off for each absence. Overall, I would definitely recommend him!

He gives 4 tests and drops the lowest grade. He also offers extra credit opportunities. I personally wouldn't take him again because I didn't like his teaching. He forgot to add my extra credit in at the end of the semester and I almost failed.

I LOVE MR. PATRONO!!!! He is so passionate about economics and is so hilarious! I truly enjoyed going to his class! I put a 3 on easiness because you have to put in some effort on the tests but I used to cram and got high c's and b's. He makes economics easy to learn. TAKE HIM! He is one of the best teachers at KSU!!

Professor Patrono is wonderful. Lectures are great make you think for yourself. Multiple choice tests + study guides. Skim the books, watch the videos, do the extra credit and study guides, go to class, and you'll get an A. Tests can be tricky, so go slowly through them. Wants you to do well & there for you if you have questionsconfusion.

Only 4 tests for the whole semester, and he drops 1. His tests were based off of his online practice quizzes. He also gives many opportunities for extra credit, equating to up to 9 bonus points on his final. He knows what he's talking about and is very respectable. I'd take him again if his lectures weren't so boring.

Patrono is an amazing Econ teacher. His lectures are interesting and he relates them to every day experiences. There are 4 tests but he drops the lowest grade. He gives the option to do extra credit .. it landed me 9 points extra on the last test grade. He provided a study guide-quiz for each chapter covered, which is almost identical to the test.

Professor Patrono's class is not hard if you study and watch the videos. His lectures were sometimes dry, but he tries to make them relatable and humorous. His tests were straight from the lectures &video study guides. Never opened commanding heights book but sometimes the ksu Econ Ed. 3Tests & the Final; lowest test grade of the three dropped

I decided to take his class based on the feedback on here .. Mostly accurate aside from your grade being a B.  You take 4 tests and he drops one. There were two chances for extra credit but he never clarifies how he will give you the extra credit. Class isn't mandatory but you need to go to pass. I DO NOT RECOMMEND TAKING, HONESTLY.

There are 4 tests that make up your grade throughout the semester. He gives you many opportunities for extra credit and will drop the lowest of the first three tests. All the extra credit given throughout the semester will be added to the final. The tests are tough, but if you study his practice quiz and read the chapter, it will be a breeze.

Professor Patrono was PHENOMENAL. going into this semester I was expecting economics to be boring, but he made it interesting and I never walked away from class confused. He gives a lot of ec opportunities and his tests weren't hard, although they did usually have an essay. I would highly recommend this professor. TAKE HIM.

Awesome class! Must read OR attend class and take notes to get an A but both aren't required. 4 tests and two papers and drops the lowest test grade. You'll want to go to class, it is interesting and he is good at relating topics to present day situations so you get a better understanding!

This class was hard. There's a lot of material he covers and the concepts are difficult. Studying is a MUST because the tests are hard. There are 4 tests and those are your only grades, so that makes it crucial that you study and do good on them. The average on mosts tests was a 60 or below-with no curve. You have a few extra credit opportunities.
Mr. Patrono is a passionate teacher who has somehow managed to make Economics interesting and easy to understand. Highly recommend.

Wish I would have had him as a freshmen. Clear, concise, and willing to explain further. Involves the class and makes corny jokes. Makes all topics relevant to today, and invites all schools of economic thought. Straight forward exams. Show up to class, take notes, watch videos, and study; you'll likely make an a or b. Wonderful professor.
Amazing and engaging lecturer, but you'll have to come to class and study accordingly to pass. Even with medium effort, you will be successful.
Patrono is a great teacher. Class isn't mandatory. Buy the book and read it before the tests! some of his questions come from the book. You have 4 tests and he drops the lowest one. Not too shabby.

You absolutely positively need the textbook in order to get a good grade in this class. Tests are pretty straight forward. You will do well if you utilize your study guides. An "A" is possible. Attendance is not mandatory.

He is a great professor, knows what he is talking about. there are a total of 4 exams, 3 regular class exams and a final. the lowest of the 3 exams is dropped so in total your grade depends on 3 exams. 33% each exam. Not fun, especially because i suck at taking exams. i found it extremely difficult.

Hard class to grasp but Patrono makes it interesting and uses real world examples everyday and is willing to help as much as he possibly can without giving you answers. I did enjoy the class which before i would have cared less to take a Econ class. ytt4cdsquare

He's really good at explaining things. However he writes all of his notes on a dry erase board. Find a good seat because it may take a few classes to get used to his handwriting. But don't let this discourage you! His class is definitely worth taking.
I really like his class, but his handwriting is horrible. So if you can read horrible handwriting or can write/type fast as he's speaking, I would recommend his class.
Great professor. Only 4 tests and one is dropped. Makes the material relateable and more easy to understand. Take him he's great.

One of the best professors at KSU! Very funny and makes econ fun! As long as you go to class every day, take notes, and study a few hours before the tests you'll get a good grade. 3 tests and a final, little extra credit. Uses many real life scenarios to thoroughly explain the material. One of the tests was hard only because of the material.

Mr Patrono is a great professor who lectures well and makes an outline of the notes on the board, but the course material is difficult if you do not review the additional information in your textbooks. READ. Mr Patrono is good though because he drops your lowest test, gives extra credit, and offers extra help after class.

Best professor I've had thus far at KSU. He clearly knows what he's talking about and makes the material easy to understand. You get out what you put in. I highly recommend taking one of his classes if you have the opportunity!

I would recommend this professor in person, but online was tough. His voice started to put me to sleep a few times. And he over-used the term "by definition" which I seriously could have turned into a drinking game if I was a drinker and thought I could bribe some friends to listen to the lectures with me.

Summer course: 3 tests, none dropped. EASY!!! The class average was always a "b" on the tests.I made 98's on the first 2 tests without opening the book. Class is not mandatory. But I would definitely recommend it because he focuses more in depth on certain issues. Also, If you have class notes you will ace the tests. Awesome professor and very nice
If you're not good at test don't take him. Only 4 tests for the semester. Lowest grade is dropped.

Hands down one of the best teachers at KSU.  He explains the material well and will answer any questions before moving on.  He wants to make sure his students understand what he is teaching and will further explain if asked.  The only grades are 3 tests and the final is another test that replaces a lowest test grade.  YOU HAVE TO STUDY TO DO WELL!

I took him Fall 2012 for ECON 2200. He's great; uses many practical real-world examples to explain concepts. Open to questions and goes step by step; will slow down if needed. 4 exams; lowest grade of first 3 exams is dropped. All that being said, this class is kind of difficult, so go to class EVERY DAY and study hard if you want to make a B.

You don't really need to go to class because all of the material relative to the tests are in his online quizzes. I failed the first test because I studied my notes, but got a B on the 2nd test when I studied the practice quizzes. Really nice, gives extra credit. Overall, he is alright and "can" be easy if you can learn from the quizzes.
this is not an easy class but not super hard either. just go to class do the study quizzes, read the book and you should be fine i got out with a 79 :(
Great professor. Really interesting lecture and covers everything that is on the test. 3 tests and very easy

Summer semester 2012. 3 tests. First test was ok. Second was easier because it was on the United States and familiar topics. Last test was hard and covered too much information on Russia, Poland etc. Gets off track in class and harps on one topic too long rather than explain all material. Read all chapters in order to get B or higher.

I took it online. Must read chapters. Gives graded quizzes 2 attempts. Drops lowest 2. He uses Wimba to teach and archives it. He is always available to explain things. Can be reached by cell. Exams are difficult but w/ LOTS of studying can do well. Easy A if you study!

Easy A, just make sure you study and attend class to take notes. 3 tests. No other work. He gives study guides for the tests. Econ is not my thing, but I managed to make an A in it. This class is really boring though. No point to buy the textbooks. I never bought them and I made an A. My friend bought hers and she didn't even open them once.

Very easy professor, as long as you attend class and read lecture material you will be garunteed an A. The test are very straight forward and sometimes only require common sense to take. This class is great for people who both do not comprehend econ as easily and for the people who do.

Not sure how you can make such a boring subject interesting but he did a pretty darn good job.  Very approachable and helpful.  Two test and a Final w/study guides). Attendance not mandatory however if ECON is not your thing I suggest going as much as possible.  If you can get him take him you'll learn something and enjoy the class.

I really enjoy this class & it was easy. 3 tests, but drop the lowest out the 3 and then there is the final which was like a regular test, easy! So, overall you had 3 tests that counts as your final grade. The first test was hard, but it gets easier after the first test. Great teacher, just keep up with his notes. Easy class, love it!

Mr. Patrono is outstanding!!! I highly recommend taking him and I would take him again. He does not force his beliefs on you like others have said, rather he simply uses real-world examples. He is very passionate about economics and wants very much to help you anyway he can!

this guy is a moron. he uses every chance he has to impose his believes on the class and get all of the different religions riled up. this isnt even a real class. there are no grades, just two tests and a final. dont even buy the book. actually, take anyone but patrono if you actually like econ and want to learn it.

Fantastic class. Not an easy class but very fascinating. Attendance is not mandatory but it is very suggested so you can get the notes and hear the lectures. Take him if you can. He is also very helpful if you have questions or need extra help. 4 tests only, no papers, no cumulative final. Pretty great.

Take him if you can get him!  He's awesome and loves what he teaches. Attendance is not mandatory and he drops the lowest test grade.  No quizzes, projects, or papers just 4 tests.  Final is not cumulative which is always a plus.

He makes economics interesting. I highly recommend taking him in an honors class if you can because the smaller group makes the class more fun and personalized. He cares about his students and is a forgiving professor.

He explains everything very clearly.  Do the quizzes he posts on Vista - they will help you on the test.  Overall, a very good teacher.  One word of caution though - make sure you use a 'cover sheet' on your tests - or the guy may go into cardiac arrest.
Patrono is the man!

The class is useful in understanding the basics of how the economy functions. No graded homework or quizzes, however the quizzes posted on GeorgiaView are a sampling of the test questions. I would recommend taking the quizzes after comparing the class notes with the text. DO NOT COME TO CLASS LATE. He will call you out in front of the class!

This professor is awesome. As long as you come to class take notes you can get an easy A in the class. He knows exactly what he is talking about and before each exam he gives a study guide which every thing that will be on that test.  on top that he drops your lowest exam grade.

He is a very good teacher as far as teaching. He gives a study guide before all the test and drops the lowest test score you receive. His Test were very tricky though. If you study very very hard you can pull out an A.

He was an easy and clear teacher. Econ to me personally is boring, however, his tests were straight from the book, his lectures, and the study guides. I took the honors class and did very well in it. He is an amazing teacher and really fair.
Incredible teacher! You can really tell that he is passionate about what he's teaching. He makes his subject very interesting and he's a really nice guy. I loved him and his class!

A lot of people told me this professor was a must take, but I found him very boring.  However, he did have moments of humor.  I honestly think the material covered was fairly boring, so it wasn't bad.  I took the honors, so all we had was 3 tests, 3 500 word essays over articles, and a final.  He dropped the lowest test grade, and I made 98s.

He is a fantasic professor! He makes econ really intresting and he cares about his students. He never tries to trick us, just to teach us. It's an easy A too :D Attendance isn't taken but almost every one comes! Take his class and you won't regret it!
Great teacher. Attendance was not mandatory, but coming to class definitely helped because a lot of what he said in class was on the test. Very fair teacher and always available for questions

I had no interest in this course topic prior to Dr. Patrono's class. His teaching style is lecture with application-(most often on funny side to keep class entertaining). He makes a boring subject come alive. Go to class and take notes...answer the study guide from your notes...get an A.
This professor is EXTREMELY easy. Don't expect to learn much if you take his class online but you will get a good grade. He drops the 3 lowest quiz grades and gives extra credit assignments.

Such an awesome teacher. Make sure you come to class and take notes and you will make an A. If you do the study guides, you will definitely get an A on the tests. Really nice and funny teacher. Patrono is the best!! I only bought the 'mandatory' book and never needed the optional one.

Very professional. Explains the material in various ways that you don't even have to buy the book, just google the info. Wish he taught all the gen ed courses. Get to know him outside of class as well... interesting person, likes to talk about an abundance of topics.

I took this class online and got a B.  You get two chances for quizzes with the 2 lowest quizzes dropped and 2 tests (mid term and final).  He gives lectures online.  Honestly I could have done better if I listened to the lectures but I didn't.  I used the book and PPT for the quizzes and tests.  Still easy though I just didn't put in the work.

Took in sum 2011.3 tests. Bring your recorder!1st test is hardest understand the graphs well.Very helpful pro.Do the studyguides and u'll make an A.Tests are some voc,ctq,&facts or background info.No extra credit offered but u wont need it.Points lost on test if you show up late!Curves test grades!Dont miss a leture if dont have x to read the book!

So Patrono is AMAZING.. I wish he was my prof. for all my classes. He is so into what he's teaching. There's basically no need for a book because I like never opened mine. If you come to the lectures your guaranteed an A+++ TAKE HIM!!

One of the best econ teachers I have ever had!! He loves the subject and knows how to get the class involved, at least most of the time. Attendance not mandatory but it's really had to keep up if you miss class. Awesome teacher!!! I would take him again in a heartbeat!!

Patrono is really good. I have taken him for several econ classes and i have gotten an A every time. You need to come to class so you can get the notes. Patrono is an awesome teacher! He makes the material intriguing with stories and references. I would most certainly take him again if I get a chance. Attendance is not mandatory. Awesome teacher who knows his stuff! If you take notes and study for the tests you should get an A.
Professor knows his stuff! 3 tests for grade. Very interesting class. Would Recommend!

The first part of the semester you do some more technical aspects of economics (supply and demand graphs, etc) and then you move in to economic history. I am not a huge history person but Patrono made the topics interesting. Did not use the book much unless I missed a lecture. Gives study guides. Take him if you can!!
Patrono's a good teacher. He makes his lectures interesting, and his tests aren't hard as long as you come to class and pay attention. I would recommend him to anybody.
